title: Strings in C++
subject: C++ Programming
theory:
**std::string** class. 
Dynamic size, Safe, Rich methods (`length()`, `append()`, `substr()`, `find()`). 
Much better than `char[]`.

common_mistakes.correction: Use std::string usually. Only use char* when talking to C APIs.

interview_questions.question: Difference between string and char[]?
interview_questions.answer: string is a Class (manages memory automatically, has methods). char[] is primitive array.
